Alastir
Sunday, August 27th, 2017, 4:00:57 AM

Weighting/Padding/Sighting got moved to it's own spot - So those items can be enchanted without a potion.

Flaring/Sanctified require a potion.

I would guess that permablessed would also require some kind of potion. But I'm still digesting all of these changes and it's probably not possible.

Leafiara
Sunday, August 27th, 2017, 4:40:33 AM

From my lower level wizard, I got to do two tests since she was 7k exp away from leveling:

| | | |------------|------------| Level | 48 -> 49 Stats: | - Aura Bonus | 14 Logic Bonus | 21 Intuition Bonus | 14 Wisdom Bonus | 18 Skills: | - AS | 58 -> 74 MIU | 100 -> 102 EMC | 50 Wizard Spell Ranks | 46 -> 48 MjE Spell Ranks | 17 MnE Spell Ranks | 37

4x katana

level 48 and 49 setups: Under these conditions, this enchantment will be nearly impossible.

5x SWCP (5 points on old system)

level 48 setup: Under the current conditions this enchantment will be difficult, but possible.

level 49 setup: You are more likely than not to succeed on your cast, but you will need some luck.

6x HCW

level 48 setup: This enchantment is completely beyond your abilities.

level 49 setup: You will likely need a miracle to complete this enchantment.

Monday, August 28th, 2017, 3:43:50 PM

Encumbrance is always a huge factor, as the potion you use can also further raise/lower the difficulty. Few pounds of encumbrance could alter the results pretty substantially.
